p: 366 patients were admitted after CPR. Overall ICU mortality in this group was 50 %. Logistic regression (Fig. 99) demonstrated a strong association between mortality and admission from a medical ward (OR 2.97) or A&E (OR 6.76). Area under the ROC was 0.81. Estimated ICU costs per survival to hospital discharge were £75,091 if admitted with an APACHE II predicted mortality >90 %, £48,000 for admission post-CPR, and £56,000 if referred from haematology.
